full_text: Valuable visit to @Rentstart Elmbridge to congratulate the team lead by Helen Watson on winning Homelessness Partnership of the year & chat to their clients. The team house ~150 tenants, & get ~1/5 into new jobs. We discussed how to  reinforce their model in challenging times. https://t.co/RCS0jLpjBr

Thanks to Molesey Art Society Chair Paul Potter for showing me around a wonderful range of local artwork - you can visit the exhibition at St Albans School in Molesey until Sunday - & support our local artists, including the brilliant Sue Monteath! https://t.co/LNaQCl1v32

2/2) And it doesn’t strike me as fair for those born male to compete with those born female in sport. 

Above all, we should work through these issues without either side of the debate shouting the other side down. https://t.co/nb44iFDvKH

1/2) This is right.👇We should be able to discuss these sensitive issues with mutual tolerance. As a father, I would not want my children taking decisions on irreversible treatments without parental involvement. https://t.co/pcZdL3UMCp

Terrific to join our @EsherWaltonCons team out in Walton-on-Thames today for the @KeepBritainTidy #GBSpringClean. The Great British Spring Clean is on until 10 April - a great chance to join local residents in cleaning up our neighbourhoods for the Spring! ♻️🌳 #BigBagChallenge https://t.co/HOJWorfeN3

Today our landmark laws ending the divorce ‘blame game’ come into force, removing unnecessary conflict and minimising the anguish children have to suffer.
To ensure time for reflection, there'll be a 20-week wait before granting a divorce. 
More info  🔽
https://t.co/3bOqSWbFpU

Thank you to the inspirational children ⁦@SSChospices⁩ who drew me this card, and a pleasure to hand over a cheque for (just under) £29k raised from my skydive in October. A big thanks to all those who supported such a worthy cause. https://t.co/RKvFHm292J
A tale of unrivalled heroism. https://t.co/gLxhZfNZBs

Russian forces should know they will be held to account for the atrocities we are seeing in Ukraine. 

We are at the forefront of supporting the ICC’s investigation, providing £1 million and law enforcement and military capabilities - to ensure justice is served.

We've put more than 3,100 offenders on an alcohol tag in the past 12 months to crack down on drink-fuelled crime.

They’re working and helping offenders stay sober 97% of the time they’re tagged. Click 🔽

https://t.co/s6iRcwuzJf

Thanks to Phil White and Sarah Drabwell at Sandown Racecourse for meeting up with me & Kay Stewart from Esher Chamber of Commerce - to discuss our plans for a Christmas celebration on Esher High St, career guidance in local schools & other community initiatives. https://t.co/tm5kG8Nnwj

Thanks to Steve Barrett, branch manager ⁦@waitrose⁩ Esher, for meeting up with me & the brilliant Kay Stewart, Chair of Esher Chamber of Commerce, to discuss local initiatives - including career advice in schools & our plans for the Christmas lights on the High Street. https://t.co/GSdMDmhXrl

Great session at Walton station first thing - talking with residents about local rail services. Invaluable feedback.
@EsherWaltonCons https://t.co/vOiJgwpZzP

It is encouraging to see the Crown Court backlog continuing to fall in today’s statistics. 

While there remains more to do, unlimited sitting days, super & Nightingale courts and increasing magistrate sentencing powers are helping to deliver swifter justice for victims.

Yesterday I set out landmark changes to the parole system to reinforce its focus on public protection.

Public protection must be the overriding priority when deciding if serious criminals are fit to leave jail.

My @TheSun article 🔽https://t.co/TlmROMgQzT

Today I updated the Commons on how we will introduce a ministerial check on decisions to release the most serious offenders.
 
We must restore confidence in the parole system and cannot take risks when it comes to public protection. Watch 🔽 https://t.co/n70k9n2TkE

Our parole system reforms will mean:
 
🔹 Public protection is the overriding priority in all decisions 
🔹 Ministerial scrutiny of decisions for the most serious criminals
🔹 A stronger release test for offenders
🔹 Victims heard throughout the process 
 
Learn more 🔽 https://t.co/Hq14cGTobL
That took courage, you have my full support. https://t.co/hxLM9WYDyy

The UK Government and @UKSupremeCourt agree it is no longer appropriate for serving UK judges to continue sitting in Hong Kong courts.

I thank all those judges who served there since 1997 – upholding the international rule of law which we proudly defend.
https://t.co/tbPCPk7ZTJ

Over a thousand offenders will be litter picking on Community Payback in support of @KeepBritainTidy’s Great British Spring Clean. 

We're investing an extra £93m so more offenders undertake rigorous, visible work to repay the damage they have caused to society. ⬇️ https://t.co/bXjXYK9nTf

Despite the majority of the public supporting the measures in the Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill, last night the Opposition - Labour & Lib Dems - chose to side with reckless protestors who block roads & ambulances. https://t.co/G63scEY8fp
Many many congratulations @Parv_Hassan !!! https://t.co/bXPHcr5JTv
Terrific to see Esher & Walton receiving extra investment for grassroots football. ⁦@EsherWaltonCons⁩ https://t.co/aGPBrok0Md

This week I met the inspiring staff @HertsBeacon who provide vital help to domestic abuse victims across Hertfordshire. 

This is just one of the many important organisations across England & Wales benefitting from our £147m per year funding boost for victim services. https://t.co/gMA28M2dIC

In addition to world-leading sanctions on Russia, and military and humanitarian support for the people of Ukraine, we're giving the @IntlCrimCourt an extra £1m this year to help them collect vital evidence to bring Russian commanders committing war crimes to justice. Watch 🔽 https://t.co/m3qMNenfdi

Thirdly, we are announcing almost £450m for victim support over three years, helping organisations provide vital advice to victims of domestic and sexual violence, as well as therapy and telephone helplines. 

Learn more 🔽 (3/3) https://t.co/GiqINUEFGH

Secondly, we’re rolling out the ability for victims of rape to pre-record their evidence to five more courts, ahead of a full nationwide rollout later this year.

Pre-recording spares victims the ordeal of giving evidence under the glare of the courtroom. (2/3)

We are determined to secure justice for more victims of crime. 

Today we are publishing local criminal justice scorecards to increase transparency across the system. (1/3)

I've chaired a meeting of 38 govts in The Hague representing a coalition of countries committed to supporting @IntlCrimCourt investigate war crimes.

The message from the international community is clear: there'll be no impunity for the harrowing loss of civilian life in Ukraine. https://t.co/UKvEvYPUJ4

We're giving @IntlCrimCourt an extra £1 million funding, plus technical law enforcement assistance to help gather evidence of war crimes in Ukraine.
 
President Putin and his Russian commanders will be held to account for their actions.
https://t.co/TG2LIjsaga

We're recruiting more prison employment specialists, like Lili, who support offenders with CV writing and interview preparation - helping ex-inmates get into work and stay away from crime.

Hear more from Lili and apply 🔽 https://t.co/xHLziAzd78

I am pleased to oversee this year’s Silk appointments.

QCs have historically been at the forefront of international justice, from Nuremberg to the Yugoslav war crime tribunals. This year's QCs stand on the shoulders of giants & will achieve great things at home & abroad. https://t.co/XOjJOllZdk

It is wrong that unscrupulous individuals & corporations exploit our courts with baseless claims designed to silence respected journalists, academics & free speech campaigners. 

Today I set out our plans to prevent oligarchs from using our courts to muzzle their critics. https://t.co/v94BzKurPB

My constituent Zara, 13, is raising money to pay for her trip to, & to help disadvantaged scouts from the UK and overseas to attend, the World Scout Jamboree in South Korea in 2023. Please consider donating below. 👇 Well done Zara! https://t.co/JDeoa30wXn

We will never tolerate corrupt elites and Putin’s allies abusing British courts to silence critics. 

Today I’ve set out measures to end this activity & protect our free and vibrant press. 📰

Learn more 👇 https://t.co/WrIjT0IOI0

In Elmbridge, the threat to our greenbelt is the Lib Dem run council - in charge for 5 out of the last 6 years, but inexplicably still haven’t put a Local Plan in place. That negligence has left us exposed to over-development and building on the Greenbelt. https://t.co/rcJZTYpFbl

Wonderful news, my heart goes out to those detained and their loved ones.

Today is a crossroads moment, as we build back a stronger & fairer society after this debilitating pandemic. 

We've responded to Sir Christopher Bellamy’s review of criminal legal aid, setting out the most significant legal aid reforms in a decade. Watch my statement ⬇️ https://t.co/OGca5vSQGg

Commanders on the ground or leaders in in the Kremlin who are committing war crimes will be held to account, and there is a very real chance they'll end up in the dock in The Hague, and ultimately behind bars.

Watch my statement on war crimes in #Ukraine. 🔽 https://t.co/tFzBGREMdc

"Russian commanders carrying out war crimes should know they cannot act with impunity. Like Radovan Karadzic and Charles Taylor before them, their actions risk landing them in a jail cell."

Read more in @DailyMailUK 🔽 

https://t.co/0UczInqeDl

Legal aid needs investment to ensure representation is there for those who most need it as we build back a fairer society after the pandemic. That's why we're increasing total funding for criminal defence to £1.2bn a year.

We’re creating a new offence to prosecute those who send unsolicited sexual images via dating sites & social media for their own gratification or to cause distress. 

We will do everything we can to protect women & girls from harm, whether on the streets, at home or online. 👇 https://t.co/djVLOOkYvO

Today I'm meeting @KarimKhanQC and others @IntlCrimCourt in The Hague to offer UK technical support in bringing those responsible for war crimes in Ukraine to justice.

Russian commanders carrying out war crimes should know they cannot act with impunity.

Protecting women and girls is my top priority which is why we're boosting victims support funding and improving rape prosecutions.

https://t.co/YrItHmcWV0

Yesterday I saw how prisoners at our newest jail, HMP Five Wells, will spend their time actively turning away from crime.

Today I was in Long Ditton at @LDSMjuniorsch to hear from Year 4 pupils on their campaign to reduce the speed limit outside the school & to receive letters on climate change from Attenborough Class (Year 6). A special thanks to Jan & Lottie who read their letters out to me! https://t.co/grTYWpJpsg

HMP Five Wells is a flagship example of our plans for secure, modern prisons. 

From abstinence-based drug recovery to world-class training, it will knock down barriers to cutting reoffending and make streets safer.

Read my @TheTimes article.

https://t.co/fW1EAmVN5K

We’re continuing to tackle the impact of the pandemic on courts. ⚖ 

▶ We’ve extended 30 Nightingale courtrooms, boosting capacity
▶ We’ve re-opened 60 Crown courtrooms since the peak of the virus  
▶ We’re back to pre-pandemic levels, with over 470 rooms available.
